text: Be silent, or say something better than silence
author: Pythagoras

text: Choices are the hinges of destiny.
author: Pythagoras

text: Envy has been, is, and shall be, the destruction of many. What is there, that Envy hath not defamed, or Malice left undefiled? Truly, no good thing.
author: Pythagoras

text: Sobriety is the strength of the soul, for it preserves its reason unclouded by passion.
author: Pythagoras

text: Choose rather to be strong of soul than strong of body.
author: Pythagoras

text: For as long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other. Indeed, he who sows the seed of murder and pain cannot reap joy and love.
author: Pythagoras

text: Friends are as companions on a journey, who ought to aid each other to persevere in the road to a happier life.
author: Pythagoras

text: Choose always the way that seems the best, however rough it may be; custom will soon render it easy and agreeable.
author: Pythagoras

text: No man is free who cannot command himself.
author: Pythagoras

text: Do not say a little in many words but a great deal in a few.
author: Pythagoras

text: Silence is better than unmeaning words.
author: Pythagoras

text: A thought is an idea in transit.
author: Pythagoras

text: Concern should drive us into action and not into a depression. No man is free who cannot control himself.
author: Pythagoras

text: As the sea-crab swimmeth always against the stream, so doth wit always against wisdom.
author: Pythagoras

text: The wind is blowing. Adore the wind.
author: Pythagoras

text: Geometry is knowledge of the eternally existent.
author: Pythagoras

text: There is geometry in the humming of the strings, there is music in the spacing of the spheres.
author: Pythagoras

text: Above the cloud with its shadow is the star with its light. Above all things reverence thyself.
author: Pythagoras

text: Learn silence. With the quiet serenity of a meditative mind, listen, absorb, transcribe, and transform.
author: Pythagoras

text: No one is free who has not obtained the empire of himself.
author: Pythagoras

text: Salt is born of the purest parents: the sun and the sea.
author: Pythagoras

text: Govern your tongue before all other things, following the gods.
author: Pythagoras

text: A fool is known by his speech; and a wise man by silence.
author: Pythagoras

text: When the wise man opens his mouth, the beauties of his soul present themselves to the view, like the statues in a temple.
author: Pythagoras

text: Beans have a soul.
author: Pythagoras

text: It is only necessary to make war with five things; . with the maladies of the body . the ignorances of the mind . with the passions of the body . with the seditions of the city . and the discords of families.
author: Pythagoras

text: Consider before acting, to avoid foolishness. It is the worthless man who speaks and acts thoughtlessly.
author: Pythagoras
